entry.title: Ethereum Museum Makeover: A Solution For Curbing Artifacts Hoarding?
entry.summary:
An Ethereum-based blockchain tool known as Salsal is under development, set to transform the way museums and cultural institutions manage and safeguard their invaluable historical collections.¬†
Spearheaded by Mark Altaweel, a distinguished professor in the archeology department at the University College of London, the Salsal project has been a collaborative effort with colleagues at Abu Dhabi University for nearly two years.
With a vision to reshape historical preservation and accountability, Salsal promises to bring about a paradigm shift in the museum sector.
Ethereum: Empowering Decentralized Heritage Management
Altaweel‚Äôs vision for Salsal¬† extends beyond mere technological advancement. He told Blockworks chain that he perceives this blockchain tool as the cornerstone for ‚Äúde‚Ä¶

entry.title: UTXOracle: A Decentralized Approach To The Oracle Problem
entry.summary:
This is an opinion editorial by Daniel Hinton, the head of finance and operations for sFOX, a bitcoin prime broker and custodian, and Steve Jeffress, creator of Bitcoin UTXO set visualizer UTXO.live. We now know how to infer the daily price of bitcoin within 1% by looking only at the unspent transaction output (UTXO) set. With this, we can build decentralized applications that rely on the UTXO set ‚Äî rather than on trusted third-party oracles ‚Äî for the USD price used in discreet log contracts (DLCs) and smart contracts. The possibilities for decentralized applications on Bitcoin using this ‚ÄúUTXOracle‚Äù are enormous.
Source: author
When You Want To Know ‚ÄòThe‚Äô Price Of Bitcoin, Where Do You Look? There is no single price of bitcoin. Every second of‚Ä¶

entry.title: Trader Makes 800 ETH In Five Minutes On Blur NFT Marketplace
entry.summary:
In a recent development, the attention of crypto Twitter has been captured by a string of transactions that occurred on the¬† Blur NFT marketplace. The transactions have raised questions of legality after a creative trader with the name, Hanwe Chang, deceived a competitor into purchasing specific Azuki NFTs at an inflated price.¬†
A Highly Controversial Transaction
Despite being a newcomer in comparison to other popular NFT marketplaces such as SuperRare and OpenSea, Blur has grown ahead of others in terms of trading volumes earlier this year, partly due to the gamified incentives that reward participants with tokens according to trade-based activity.¬†
This includes rewards in the form of an airdrop offered to users that bid on Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs) by trait, a practice which, a‚Ä¶

entry.title: FBI Issues Warning on Scam Involving Criminals Impersonating NFT Developers
entry.summary: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has issued a Public Service Announcement (PSA) warning about criminals impersonating non-fungible token (NFT) developers in social media. According to the PSA, criminals can impersonate these developers on social media by hijacking accounts or using similar account names and directing interested users to fake NFT sales pages to drain their wallets. FBI Warns Users About NFT Scams The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has issued a Public Service Announcement (PSA) warning users about non-fungible token (NFT) scams involving criminals impersonating developers of renowned projects. To target NFT-interested users, the criminals might take different routes, hijacking the accounts of these significant NFT projects or using almost identical account na‚Ä¶

entry.title: Curve Finance Recovers over 70% of Hacked Funds: Report
entry.summary: The hackers who exploited Curve Finance have returned 73% of the tokens stolen from the decentralized finance (DeFi) platform. So far, the amount of tokens returned is estimated at USD $53 million, according to a report by a blockchain data analytics platform. About a week ago, Curve Finance, the DeFi platform for stablecoins, was exploited through a reentrancy bug on its smart contracts programming language, Vyper. This action led to price volatility in CRV, the native token of the DeFi platform. Additionally, it prompted the cryptocurrency exchange, Upbit to suspend deposits and withdrawals of the token. "A number of stablepools (alETH/msETH/pETH) which are using Vyper 0.2.15 have been exploited as a result of a malfunctioning reentrancy lock," a representative from Cur‚Ä¶

entry.title: Major Week Ahead For Bitcoin And Crypto: 3 Must-Watch Events
entry.summary:
For the Bitcoin and crypto market, the upcoming week promises to be a pivotal one. While the US Consumer Price Index (CPI), Jobless Claims, Producer Price Index (PPI) and Michigan Consumer Sentiment are all on the horizon, three events stand out as particularly: the July release of the CPI and PPI data, as well as the much-anticipated Bitcoin ETF decision for ARK Invest.
Consumer Price Index (CPI) On Thursday (8:30 am EST)
The CPI, a key measure of inflation, has been under the microscope as the US grapples with fluctuating inflation rates. The headline CPI is expected to rise from 3% to 3.3% YoY in July, a notable shift as beneficial base effects from the previous year begin to fade. The Cleveland Fed‚Äôs Inflation Nowcast model even forecasts a 3.42% headline CPI, slightly above the co‚Ä¶

entry.title: Hong Kong Raises Alarm on Crypto Platforms Just Two Months after Easing Regulations
entry.summary: More than two months ago, cryptocurrency regulations in Hong Kong loosened considerably, allowing retail traders back into the market. However, as it turns out, the Securities and Futures Commission (SFC) has recently identified increased improper activities being carried out by some unlicensed virtual asset trading platforms (VATPs). Not only are these practices deceptive, but they endanger investors. The regulator raised four main concerns and their implications for both VATPs and retail investors. SFC Warns against Improper Practices In its latest warning, the SFC drew attention to several important issues concerning cryptocurrency trading in Hong Kong. The first issue pertains to false information about applying for a cryptocurrency license in the special administra‚Ä¶

entry.title: Crypto Exchange OPNX Emerges As Potential Savior For Troubled Hodlnaut ‚Äì Report
entry.summary:
OPNX Exchange emerges as a potential savior for crypto lender Hodlnaut as it navigates the complexities of bankruptcy proceedings. A recent report from Bloomberg reveals that the exchange has extended a lifeline to the struggling company. By presenting a proposition to acquire 75% ownership, OPNX Exchange aims to rejuvenate Hodlnaut‚Äôs fortunes.¬†
The proposal entails an infusion of $30 million worth of FLEX tokens into the enterprise, a strategic move aimed at facilitating partial restitution to the company‚Äôs creditors, as disclosed in the report.¬†
This development underscores the intricate interplay between the world of digital finance and traditional economic mechanisms, signaling a potential turning point for Hodlnaut‚Äôs future.
Innovative Creditor Restitution Plan Unveiled

entry.title: Scottish Author Exposing Onecoin Cancels ‚ÄòDevil‚Äôs Coin‚Äô Book Tour After Death Threats
entry.summary:
An author from Scotland has been targeted for her work to expose one of crypto history‚Äôs most notorious Ponzi schemes, Onecoin. Jennifer McAdam recently canceled book signings after receiving death threats for writing about the massive fraud and its ‚ÄòCryptoqueen‚Äô mastermind.
Writer Cancels Promotional Events for Book on Onecoin on Advice From Scottish Police and FBI
Author Jennifer McAdam has been forced to cancel a promotional tour for her book ‚ÄòDevil‚Äôs Coin‚Äô exposing the crypto pyramid Onecoin which defrauded millions of investors around the world, the Scottish Sun newspaper reported.
McAdam writes about Onecoin‚Äôs founder Ruja Ignatova, dubbed the ‚Äúmissing Cryptoqueen‚Äù as she is still wanted by Interpol, Europol, and the U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI), which put it on i‚Ä¶

entry.title: Huobi's $500 Million Nightmare: From a Rumor to Alleged Insolvency
entry.summary:
Rumors can act as a dangerous weapon, triggering panic and leading to capital flight. The cryptocurrency exchange, Huobi learned this the hard way, losing $500 million due to gossip that its leadership had been arrested in China and that the platform was on the verge of bankruptcy. Huobi's TVL Drops by $500 Million Initial reports of Huobi's troubles emerged on 4 August after the initial news that representatives from the exchange had been arrested in China in relation to investigations involving ties to gambling platforms. On Twitter, Huobi's spokesperson stated that rumors regarding the arrest of high-ranking exchange representatives were false.
The source has been verified as a senior executive at Tron who has first hand knowledge of the investigation and has been a‚Ä¶

entry.title: Huobi Insolvency Fears Surge Post-Exec Arrests: Crypto Storm Ahead?
entry.summary:
In a recent series of tweets, Adam Cochran, a well-known analyst in the crypto community and angel investor, has raised serious concerns about the solvency of Huobi, the world‚Äôs 12th largest crypto exchange by spot volume. This comes in the wake of reports that several executives from Huobi and Tron have been taken into custody by Chinese authorities for investigation.
Cochran‚Äôs claims are based on a detailed analysis of Huobi‚Äôs balance sheets and the recent activities of Justin Sun, the founder of Tron. He alleges that Sun has been using the exchange as a personal piggy bank, diverting funds to his other DeFi projects, and leaving the exchange with insufficient assets to meet its obligations.
‚ÄúSo users think they have balances of $631M in Huobi, but there is only $90M there. The rest ‚Ä¶

Honduras Opens CBDC Issuance Public Consultation The Central Bank of Honduras has opened a public consultation regarding issuing a central bank digital currency (CBDC). The public consultation marks the next phase of a plan to modernize the country‚Äôs payment systems. In a report issued by the bank, titled ‚ÄúThe Future of Money and Payments in Honduras, which route to Follow?‚Äù the institution considers the implications and changes it must apply to its legal system to adopt a CBDC. entry.title: 'Big Respect Between Ethereum and Cosmos Developer Communities': dYdX Foundation CEO
entry.summary: CEO of the dYdX Foundation Charles d'Haussy unpacks the decision behind moving one of the largest decentralized exchange protocol's over to its very own chain built on Cosmos. A key driver, he told Decrypt at this year's EthCC event, was that instead of launching on a rollup or another layer-1, launching a fully customized chain will allow dYdX to fine tune the network for its product's needs.

entry.title: Ethereum Staking Solution Lido 'Had Perfect Product Market Fit' at Launch, Says DAO's Biz Dev Contributor
entry.summary: Marin Tvrdiƒá, a business development contributor to the Lido DAO, sat down with Decrypt during this year's EthCC to break down how the liquid staking protocol has managed such a massive lead, how it plans to keep that lead, and the protocol's new dual-governance tokenomics.

entry.title: What's Going to Stop All the DeFi Hacks? 'Standards,' Says OpenZepplin Security Architect
entry.summary: OpenZeppelin's security solutions architect Michael Lewellen sat down with Decrypt to discuss how the industry can become a little safer for users at this year's EthCC Paris. The key? Introducing security standards across the industry so folks know what an audit actually means and where risks lie, be it bad faith actors or poor implementation.

entry.title: 'Ev.io' Game Review: Earn Solana While Blasting Enemies
entry.summary: Ev.io is a web-based first-person shooter that's free to play, but lets NFT holders earn in-game currency that can be redeemed for Solana (SOL). Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin shares his review of the fun throwback to Quake-style blasting, albeit with a modern crypto twist.

entry.title: 'Moving Fast and Breaking Things Isn't the Web3 Ethos': MetaMask Product Lead
entry.summary: Account abstraction this, smart wallets that. Discussions at EthCC Paris about improving user experience have pointed at industry leader MetaMask as an example of what not to do. But that may soon change, with a host of updates and optimizations coming to crypto's number one wallet, said its product lead Alex Jupiter. It still may take some time, though, before these changes take effect.

entry.title: Scaling Smart Wallets on Starknet 'Was The Winning Combination', Says Argent Co-Founder
entry.summary: Argent co-founder Julien Niset told Decrypt at EthCC Paris that he wants to make crypto wallets disappear. Or at least how they're currently conceived. From clunky seed phrases to a stiff user experience, Argent hopes to make using crypto a little less intimidating and a whole lot more fun.

entry.title: Inside Mighty Action Heroes' Open Beta
entry.summary: Mighty Action Heroes is the flagship blockchain title from Mighty Bear Games. But is the browser-based battle royale shooter worth checking out? Decrypt's Kate Irwin offers her thoughts and a first look at the upcoming game.

entry.title: Dr. Disrespect's 'Deadrop': Early Access Gameplay From Snapshot VI
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin playtests Dr. Disrespect and Midnight Society's first-person shooter Deadrop and shares the latest game updates, as well as her opinions on the game in development. Currently, Deadrop offers Polygon Founders Pass NFTs with no other crypto plans revealed just yet.

entry.title: 'More and More' Game Publishers Will Embrace NFTs: Mythical Games CEO
entry.summary: In the wake of EA Sports and Fortnite creator Epic Games embracing Nike's NFT platform, Mythical Games CEO John Linden tells Decrypt's Andrew Hayward how quickly he expects to see more major traditional game publishers enter the blockchain space and how quickly the industry will scale.

entry.title: Gran Saga Unlimited Early Access: Inside the Anime MMORPG on Aptos
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin plays Gran Saga: Unlimited's second community playtest, reports her findings, and offers her opinion and insights on the upcoming game, which will offer optional Aptos NFTs.

entry.title: 100 Thieves' Moe Says Blockchain Games Will 'Eventually' Be Accepted by Livestreamers
entry.summary: 100 Thieves content creator and gamer Moe also goes by "Yassuo" online after his favorite League of Legends character. Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks him about 100 Thieves' future crypto plans and whether Moe thinks creators like xQc and Pokimane might ever come around to blockchain games.
